snippet: The French government confirmed Wednesday that it would seek a second three-month extension of the state of emergency declared after the Paris attacks in November.
abstract: French government will seek three-month extension of state of emergency put into effect after Nov 2015 Paris terrorist attacks; ongoing terrorist threat cited as rationale for move and for several other measures increasing authorities' anti-terrorism powers; protests erupt as critics claim laws compromise civil liberties and fail to significantly curb terrorism.
lead_paragraph: The French government confirmed Wednesday that it would seek a second three-month extension of the state of emergency declared after the Paris attacks in November.

headline.main: France Seeks to Extend State of Emergency Despite Protests
headline.print_headline: France Seeks to Extend Emergency Despite Protests

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
